episode_title: 420 - The One With All the Wedding Dresses

content.description: Joey’s bedroom, he is asleep and snoring loudly. Chandler enters wondering who left their engine running.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you kidding me?! Joey. Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Joey. Joey. Joey. Joey! Joey!!
(Chandler acts disgusted, but is happy that Joey has stopped snoring. However, just as he is about to leave, Joey starts snoring again. So to get him to stop, he slams the door shut, waking Joey.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh. Oh, did-did-did I wake you?

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler is getting another cup of coffee.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Gunther, can I get another cup of coffee, please? (Gunther starts to pour him another cup.) So uh, what do you do when you’re not working here?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: You don’t need to fill these silences.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, okay, thanks. (He goes back to the couch and rejoins Monica, Joey, and Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, that’s like your fourth cup of coffee!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I am drinking lots of cups of coffee because I’m exhausted! Because Joey started snoring!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s in a different room! He’s really that loud?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you should here me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s not something to be proud of, okay? You have to go to a sleep clinic!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, I told ya, I’m not going to any clinic! I don’t have a problem, you’re the one with the problem! You should go to a “Quit being a baby and leave me alone” clinic!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They don’t have those.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, they do! Quit being a baby and leave me alone! There, you’ve just had your first class!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know I used to go out with this guy that was a really light sleeper, and whenever I started to snore, he would just roll me over…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohhh, yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He would just roll me over and I would stop snoring.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Next time you snore, I’m rolling ya over!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I gotta do what I gotta do, you gotta do what you gotta do, you just do it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey guys!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, all right!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!
(Joey starts humming Here Come the Bride.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, the Olympics.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Have you guys picked a date yet?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no, not yet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I still cannot believe you’re engaged! (Ross looks at her) Just ‘cause its happening so fast; not ‘cause you’re such a loser.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. Thanks. Uh, has anyone seen Rach?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ugh, she’s upstairs not doing the dishes! And I tell ya something! I’m not doing them this time! I don’t care if those dishes sit in the sink until they’re all covered with—I’ll do them when I get home!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah—oh! Hey listen umm, Emily found this wedding dress in London…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Already?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, but it didn’t fit. Well, luckily there’s a store here that has one left in her size, but I’m the groom, I’m not supposed to see the dress…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll pick it up for you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, she’s got you running errands, y’know, picking up wedding dresses… (Laughs and makes like Indiana Jones and his whip) Wah-pah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s wah-pah?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, whipped! Wah-pah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s not whipped! Whipped is wh-tcssh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s what I did. Wah-pah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You can’t do anything!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is not doing the dishes. She hears someone coming up the stairs and quickly puts down her magazine and pretends like she’s actually doing the dishes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, Mon, I was just doing the dishes!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! It’s you. (She stops doing the dishes.) Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, do uh, do you have a minute?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, yeah, I was just about to take a break anyways, so…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So listen uh, I know you and I haven’t really had a chance to talk since uh, Emily and I decided to get married, and uh, I was just wondering how you were.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know if you were getting married I’d feel, kinda… y’know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Yeah. Definitely, well it definitely took me by surprise, but I’m okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, I just wanted to check.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, that’s sweet.
(He goes over to hug her.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re great. And I-I know someday this will happen for you too. You just hang in there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uhh, hang in there?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, no, I didn’t mean, uh…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean maybe you didn’t hear about a serious relationship called me and Joshua?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I thought you guys had just been on like four dates, I didn’t realise that had become anything, yet.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, no-no-no, no-no-no, it has become, it has—yeah. Oh no, those were four great dates.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Oh, yeah. And I mean, the connection, I mean y’know, emotionally, mentally, physically…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow, that’s-that’s-that’s incredible.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know isn’t it? It’s like I’m right there with Joshua.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You are right there with Emily. And it’s y’know, it’s kinda like… it’s a tie! Well, I gotta get, I gotta get back to the dishes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I gotta get to work.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah? Fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, y’know, y’know what would make me really happy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, no, what’s that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: If like the four of us could all y’know, hang out together. Uh, in fact Emily’s coming into town this weekend, why don’t you say we all have dinner? Say, Sunday night?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That would be great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, all right, it’s a date. (He leaves)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hang in there. You hang in there. (Gives him the raspberry.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Did you say something?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, just singing. (Does a little song.)

content.description: Beatrice Bridal Shop, Monica and Phoebe are there to pick up Emily’s dress.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! Ohh! Look at this one! It’s so beautiful!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but y’know, about have of these are gonna end up getting divorced.

content.speaker: The Saleslady
content.text: May I help you ladies?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, yes, umm, I’m here to pick up a dress that you have on hold.

content.speaker: The Saleslady
content.text: Yes, what’s the name, please?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Emily Waltham.

content.speaker: The Saleslady
content.text: Yes! I have it right here. (Phoebe and Monica both gasp at the dress.) Would you like to try it on Ms. Waltham?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.
[Time lapse. Monica is wearing the dress and starring at herself in the mirror.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re the most beautiful bride I’ve ever seen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am, aren’t I?

content.speaker: The Saleslady
content.text: Ms. Waltham?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes?

content.speaker: The Saleslady
content.text: We’re closing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right. (Goes to take off the dress.)

content.speaker: The Saleslady
content.text: And could I get my ring back?
(She disgustedly takes the ring off and gives it back.)

content.description: Joey’s bedroom, he’s snoring again and Chandler is there to roll him over.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right buddy, time to roll over. (Rolls him over, and discovers a surprise) (Looking down) No-no! (Covers his eyes) No, no-n-n-n-no!! You are going to a clinic! You’re going to a clinic, and a pyjama store!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is doing the dishes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Does she use the cups? Yes! I believe she does. Does she use the plates? Yes! I believe she does. (Looks at the wedding dress and stops.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. Thank you. Ohhh, thank you very much. Oh, thank you for coming. (There’s a knock on the door.) Uh, just a second!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no, let me in!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Can you just hold on for one minute?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, you have to let me in right now!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you alone?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right.
(She goes over and lets Phoebe bounce in wearing her own wedding dress.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is complaining about going to the clinic.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This sucks! I didn’t know I had to stay up all night before I went to this stupid sleep clinic! I’m so tired!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, well…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, I hear that you and Joshua are going out to dinner with Ross and Emily, and I think that’s, I think that’s really cool.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, Rach, I think you’re handling that really well.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Handling it? What do you mean, handling it? There’s nothing to handle. Now, maybe I would have a problem with this if it wasn’t for me and Joshua. Y’know, they’re not gonna get married anyway!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on! They rushed into this thing so fast it’s ridiculous! I mean, they’re gonna be engaged for like what? A year? And somewhere along the way, one of them is gonna realise what they’ve done and they’re call the whole thing off. I’m telling ya, you’re gonna be dancing at my wedding before you’re dancing at there’s.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well, I don’t dance at weddings.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because weddings are a great place to meet women, and when I dance, I look like this… (Starts to dancing really, really, really badly. Ross enters behind him and he stops.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey man.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, what are you guys doing four weeks from today?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nothing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nothing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I am… (Looks in his date book.) free!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Great! Because Emily and I are getting married in a month!

content.speaker: Joey and Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yep!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: In a month?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You mean, you mean 30 days?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: From now?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, that’s great.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! Yeah, Emily always wanted to get married in this beautiful place that her parents got married, but it’s going to be torn down, so… I mean, I-I know it’s crazy, but everything up ‘til now has been so crazy, and I don’t know, this just feels right. Y’know?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! That’s the day after I stop menstruating! (They all look at him.) This isn’t mine.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is waiting impatiently for Joshua.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Hey, Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: What’s up? You’re voice sounded all squeaky on the phone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, nothing, I just wanted to see you. See you and hug you. (Hugs him) See you.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Great!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! (She sits down) Sit!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: You okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m more than okay, I am really, really happy! Wanna know why?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Do I?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: ‘Cause I am really happy about us. I think we are, I think we are so on the right track! Y’know? I mean, I think we are working, I think we are clicking. Y’know?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Yeah, sure-sure, yeah, we’re-we’re-we’re-we’re-we’re clicking.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah-yeah, y’know if-if there was just like one little area where I—that I think we need—we would need to work on; I-I would think it was we’re just not crazy enough!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: I-I gotta say, I-I-I-I’m not too sure I agree with that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, yeah, right, y’know what? Yeah, you’re right, I mean, we no, we have our fun. Yeah! But if (Grunts uncomprehensively)……I mean, I mean like craaaazy ! Y’know? Okay, all right. This is gonna, this is gonna sound y’know, a little umm, hasty, but uh, just go with it. Umm. Ugh. What if we got married?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: What?! (Gunther is listening in.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I know, I know, it’s-it’s so, it’s so totally like, “Whoa! Can we do this?” Y’know, I mean, but I mean it just feels right! Don’t you think? It does! I mean, it just feels right, don’t you think?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Wow! Uhh, Rachel uhh, you’re a real special lady, but my divorce isn’t final yet and, and, and we’ve been on four days, so I’m thinking “No, but thanks.”

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: YOU IDIOT !!!!!

content.description: The Sleep Clinic, Joey is having trouble staying awake.

content.speaker: Sleep Clinic Worker
content.text: Your name, please?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Joey Tribbiani.

content.speaker: Sleep Clinic Worker
content.text: Um-hmm, and did you stay up all night in preparation for your sleep study. (Joey doesn’t answer) Uh, sir? (Joey starts snoring)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes he did.

content.speaker: Sleep Clinic Worker
content.text: Alll right, we’ll call you in a few minutes.
(As she leaves, a beautiful woman enters and sits down across from the boys.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, check out that girl! She is really hot!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, she is. Wow! (Falls back asleep, loudly) How you doin’?
(Chandler wakes him up, again.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re coming on to the entire room! (He goes over to pick up a stack of magazines next to her, and to get her attention, he throws them back down.) I’m Chandler.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I’m Marjorie.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Marjorie
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You mind if I…

content.speaker: Marjorie
content.text: No, please.
(He sits down next to her.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So uh, what are you in for?

content.speaker: Marjorie
content.text: I talk in my sleep.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What a coincidence, I listen in my sleep.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So why don’t you give me your number?

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Phoebe, still defying reality, are now throwing a bouquet at each other, pretending to catch the actual bouquet at an actual wedding.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, ready?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.
(She turns around and throws the bouquet to Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I got it! Mine! (They both hug)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Congratulations!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! My turn! My turn!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay! (Gets into position) Okay, ready?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.
content.parenthetical: cocking her head from side to side in some pre-bouquet-catching ritual

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (Phoebe turns and throws it on the couch.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That was a terrible throw!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m not gonna right to you! That’s not real!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look at me! My big concern is what’s real?! (Finally realises) Oh my God. We’re really sad, aren’t we?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I think we are.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This isn’t even my dress.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, at least you didn’t rent yours from a store called, “It’s Not Too Late.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m changing out of this.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Me too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: In like a half-hour?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Me too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, throw it straight this time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.
(She throws it straight, and Monica makes a big deal about catching it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m getting married next!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yay!

content.description: Central Perk, Monica and Phoebe, back to reality, are sitting in normal clothes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I hate my regular clothes now! Y’know? I look down and-and I know that this isn’t gonna be the most special day of my life.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. I mean it was kinda fun for a while, but didn’t you start feeling silly?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I guess.
(Monica crosses her legs and is still wearing the garter belt.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, you’re such a cheater!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello! Little ones.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, is Joey gonna stop snoring?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yep! And! A beautiful woman agreed to go out with me. (They’re stunned.) Joey wanted to ask her out, but uh, she picked me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, how’d that happen?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because I’m cooler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, seriously.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well she’s, she’s the kinda girl—Joey was unconscious.
(Joey enters, wearing a mouth guard like boxers wear.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey you guys! What’s happening?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What is that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, they gave it to me at the sleep clinic, and it’s gonna help me not to snore.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, are you asleep right now, Joe? ‘Cause I don’t think you have to wear it unless you are!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know I don’t have too! It tastes good. (Puts it back in.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Plus, you look cool.
(Joey totally agrees with this statement and kicks his feet up.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is putting away the wedding dress, finally.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I just called Joshua…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, how did it go?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I did my best to convince him that I’m not some crazy girl who is dying to get married—I’m just going through a hard time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What did he say?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well uh, his answering machine was very understanding. Ugh. I feel blue.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, sweetie! (Goes to comfort her.) Hey, I bet you anything that he’s gonna call you again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, maybe, but I don’t think I even care. I don’t think he’s the one I’m sad about. Y’know, I know that I said that I am totally okay with Ross getting married, but as it turns out, I don’t think I’m handling it all that well.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, maybe.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And I-I am just trying to figure out why.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Any luck?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, yeah, y’know how Ross and I were on again, off again, on again, off again? I guess I just figured that somewhere down the road, we would be on again.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Again. Y’know what? I think we all did.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! (She jumps up and throws Emily’s wedding dress into Rachel’s room.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, I got us some reservations for Sunday night, okay? How about, Ernie’s at 9 o’clock?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, well, you uh, better make it for three.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, see I-I don’t know if we’re gonna be hungry at three.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Three people. Joshua’s not gonna be there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, well, I think, I think he broke up with me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Noo. Why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, apparently he scares easy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, Rachel, I’m-I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s okay. Sometimes, things don’t work out the way you’d thought they would.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come here.
(They hug.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hey, don’t you have to go pick up Emily?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! I got my girls.
(He leaves.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh. (She goes over and lays her head on Phoebe’s lap.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, y’know what might cheer you up?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?
[Time lapse, all three girls are now wearing wedding dresses, eating popcorn, drinking beer, and watching TV.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, I gotta tell ya, this really does put in a better mood.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I wish there was a job where I could wear this all the time. (Pause) Maybe someday, there will be.
(There’s a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God! He’s gonna come by and borrow some candles for his big date!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, okay! (She goes to answer the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No-no, Rachel, don’t get it! He can’t see us!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, yeah! The groom cannot see the bride!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not gonna marry Chandler!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not after this!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, you guys, just relax. (She goes over to open the door, and as she does, she says.) I doooo. (Sees that it’s Joshua, not Chandler that knocked on the door.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: I gotta go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, wait, Joshua! Joshua! (Pause) (Comes back inside) Yeah, well, that oughta do it.

content.description: Chandler’s bedroom, he is sleeping with Marjorie. All of the sudden, Marjorie starts talking in her sleep, awakening Chandler. After a little bit, she quiets back down, and Chandler tries to get back to sleep. There’s a short pause until she starts screaming, causing Chandler to scream with her. She quickly calms down. This all wakes up Joey, who comes over wearing the mouth guard, opens the top half of Chandler’s door, and starts to complain about the noise.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude! I am trying to sleep! (Shrugs to say, “What’s up with that?”)
